general_provisions: This bill addresses collective bargaining for public employees.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the Labor Relations Board (board);<hr><ltbullet>describes the composition and duties of the board;<hr><ltbullet>describes the entities the board may employ;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the board's rulemaking authority;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the board to subpoena witnesses and administer oaths;<hr><ltbullet>establishes who may serve as counsel for public employers and the board;<hr><ltbullet>creates protections for public employees regarding self-organization;<hr><ltbullet>allows a public employer to deduct an employee's dues for a collective bargaining unit from an employee's pay;<hr><ltbullet>requires that labor organizations represent employees without discriminations;<hr><ltbullet>requires that the board investigate a petition on a representation question under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>establishes criteria and the function of a representation election at the direction of the board;<hr><ltbullet>establishes who may represent a public employer in collective bargaining;<hr><ltbullet>establishes management rights of a public employer;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a duty to bargain collectively for both the public employer and an exclusive representative;<hr><ltbullet>describes what a collective bargaining agreement shall contain;<hr><ltbullet>permits and describes the mediation of disputes relating to collective bargaining;<hr><ltbullet>describes how to initiate fact finding relating to a dispute regarding collective bargaining;<hr><ltbullet>establishes fact finding proceedings in a dispute related to collective bargaining;<hr><ltbullet>allows arbitration for a dispute resulting from collective bargaining;<hr><ltbullet>requires the board to establish an education course for fact finders and arbitrators;<hr><ltbullet>describes an unfair labor practice of a public employer;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the process by which an unfair labor practice is investigated and resolved;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a hearing process for an unfair labor practice complaint hearing;<hr><ltbullet>describes the process of the court enforcement and review of a board order;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits police officers from engaging in strikes;<hr><ltbullet>establishes criteria for mediation of a dispute under certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes the criteria for arbitration under certain circumstances.
